title: Toranmal
subtitle: A serene plateau surrounded by hills, valleys, and tribal culture
overview: Toranmal is a quiet and beautiful hill station located in the Satpura mountain range in Nandurbar district of Maharashtra. Perched at around 1,150 meters above sea level, it offers cool climate, stunning plateaus, lakes, waterfalls, and dense forests.
It is one of Maharashtra’s lesser-known destinations, often visited by pilgrims and nature enthusiasts alike. The area is also rich in tribal culture and biodiversity.
The highlight of Toranmal is its peacefulness and unspoiled natural charm, making it perfect for offbeat travelers seeking solitude and eco-retreats.

highlights.title: Yashwant Lake

highlights.title: Tribal Culture
highlights.description: Home to Bhil and Pawara tribes with rich heritage

geography.intro: Toranmal is located in the Satpura ranges of northern Maharashtra, close to the Madhya Pradesh border. It rests on a plateau and is surrounded by valleys and forests.

details.label: Vegetation
details.value: Deciduous forests, wildflowers, and medicinal plants

climate.description: Toranmal experiences a pleasant climate throughout the year. Summers are mild, monsoons are lush, and winters are chilly.

geography.conclusion: The hill station’s geography makes it ideal for hiking, meditation, and connecting with nature.

activities.title: Nature Walks
activities.description: Enjoy peaceful walks through forest trails and around the lake.
info: Best done in early morning or sunset
Take guidance from locals for longer trails

activities.title: Boating at Yashwant Lake
activities.description: Soak in the calm vibes with paddle boating in the lake.

activities.title: Temple Visits
activities.description: Visit the Gorakhnath temple and surrounding shrines.
info: Avoid peak Mahashivratri crowd if seeking peace

attractions.title: Yashwant Lake
attractions.description: Central freshwater lake surrounded by greenery and walking paths.

attractions.title: Gorakhnath Temple
attractions.description: Spiritual center that attracts pilgrims from Maharashtra and Madhya Pradesh.

attractions.title: Check Dam Viewpoint
attractions.description: Offers panoramic views of the dam and valley below.

attractions.title: Sita Khai
attractions.description: A deep gorge named after Sita with beautiful cliffs and viewpoints.

marineLife.intro: Toranmal is a hill station and does not feature marine life, but its freshwater ecosystems support rich biodiversity.

items.title: Bird Watching
items.description: Spot kingfishers, eagles, and parakeets in forest and lake areas.

items.title: Local Wildlife
items.description: Includes monkeys, civets, porcupines, and forest reptiles.

conclusion: Toranmal encourages eco-tourism and preservation of tribal ecology.
Nature walks and lake visits are ideal for families and photographers.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Drive from Nashik or Dhule via Shahada

howToReach.title: By Air
details: Nearest Airport: Aurangabad or Indore (200–250 km)

bookingTips.description: Best time to book: October to February
Carry your own vehicle or driver for convenience
